definition[0]: the act of paying for something that you have not yet received, or the amount involved
example[0]: Hall-Houston Offshore received $20 million in prepayments for natural gas production in the Gulf of Mexico.
definition[1]: the act of repaying a loan to the lender before the normal time, or the amount involved
example[1]: TW Holdings Inc. is making two prepayments totaling $70 million on senior debt.
example[2]: Weâ€™d like to get out of the loan, but it carries expensive prepayment penalties (=additional costs for repaying early).
definition[2]: the act of paying tax in an earlier TAX YEAR than the time it needs to be paid, in order to avoid paying more tax later, or the amount involved
